ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Display
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Display
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is used to display the content of the odometer variables (x, y, Theta). This class include constants and class variables that specifies the display behaviours of the LCD on the EV3 platform. The class implements the Runnable interface and has a run() method

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Display(TextLCD lcd)
      This is the class constructor which initializes the odometer and the LCD display.
      Display(TextLCD lcd, long timeout)
      This is the overloaded class constructor, initializes odometer and LCD but also with a updated time limit.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void run()
      This method sets up the LCD display for the robot and updates the position values at a specific rate.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Display

        public Display(TextLCD lcd)
        throws OdometerExceptions
        This is the class constructor which initializes the odometer and the LCD display.
        Parameters:
        lcd - - the LCD display instance
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions - - throws odometer exceptions if fails to get odometer

      • Display

        public Display(TextLCD lcd,
               long timeout)
        throws OdometerExceptions
        This is the overloaded class constructor, initializes odometer and LCD but also with a updated time limit. Gives user option of changing time limit.
        Parameters:
        lcd - - The LCD display object
        timeout - - Time limit set by user for display program
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions - - throws odometer exceptions if fails to get odometer

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method sets up the LCD display for the robot and updates the position values at a specific rate. The output is formatted to 2 decimal places
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
